philipm.cs5.software.development.user.system

Class ChessBoardState

  • java.lang.Object
    • philipm.cs5.software.development.user.system.ChessBoardState

  • public class ChessBoardState
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to store all data needed for a single board state
    Author:
    mortimer

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessBoardState

        public ChessBoardState(java.lang.String fenString)
        Takes the FEN String (standard representation of chess board as input)
        Parameters:
        fenString - The FEN string. For explanation of FEN format, view https://www.chess.com/terms/fen-chess

      • ChessBoardState

        public ChessBoardState(int[][] gameBoard,
                       boolean[] castlingRights,
                       boolean isBlackToPlayNext,
                       int fullMoveNumber,
                       int halfMoveClock,
                       int[] enPassantSquare)
        Creates a new chess board state
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - The board array
        castlingRights - The castling rights. In the form, white kingside, white queen side, black kingside, black queen side
        isBlackToPlayNext - whether black is to make the next move
        fullMoveNumber - the number of moves black has played
        halfMoveClock - the number of moves both players have made since the last pawn advance or capture
        enPassantSquare - the y and x coordinates of a square that can be captured via en passant. If no such square exists, use new int[0]

    • Method Detail

      • getNeuralNetInputDouble

        public double[] getNeuralNetInputDouble()
        Converts the current board state to a form where it can be input to the neural network.
        Returns:
        The double array that can be input to the trained neural network.

      • getNeuralNetInput

        public int[] getNeuralNetInput()
        Gets the string used for the neural network input given the current board state
        Returns:
        The input to the neural network

        public java.lang.String getFenString()
        Gets FEN string from board state
        Returns:
        The FEN String

      • getStringOfSquare

        private static java.lang.String getStringOfSquare(int y,
                                                  int x)
        Gets the string value of a square given its y and x coordinates. E.g. getStringOfSquare(1,0) = "a7"
        Parameters:
        y - The y index in the board array
        x - The x index in the board array
        Returns:
        The square

      • getNeuralNetInputReducedSize

        public int[] getNeuralNetInputReducedSize()
        Gets the neural network input for a reduced size neural network that does not use the bitboard representation.
        Returns:
        The network input

      • getNeuralNetInputReducedSizeDouble

        public double[] getNeuralNetInputReducedSizeDouble()
        Gets a reduced size neural network input as a double array.
        Returns:
        The neural network input

      • getYAndXOfSquare

        private static int[] getYAndXOfSquare(java.lang.String square)
        Takes a chess square, such as "a3" as input and returns the y and x coordinates of the square on the board
        Parameters:
        square - The square
        Returns:
        An int array of length [2], with the y and x index for the board array

      • getCopyOfBoard

        public int[][] getCopyOfBoard()
        Gets a copy of the board array. use this when writing with board
        Returns:
        A copy of the board array

      • getCopyOfCastlingRights

        public boolean[] getCopyOfCastlingRights()
        Returns a copy of the castling rights array
        Returns:
        The castling rights

      • getCopyOfEnPassantSquare

        public int[] getCopyOfEnPassantSquare()
        Gets a copy of the en passant square array and returns it.
        Returns:
        The copy of the array

      • getIsWin

        public boolean getIsWin()
        Returns whether this game is a win. Note this variable may not be initialised and can only be set by external methods. Hence, only call this method if you are certain that the board state has been set.
        Returns:
        Whether the board is a win for the current user

      • getIsDraw

        public boolean getIsDraw()
        Returns whether this game is a draw. Note: this variable is not automatically initialised and is set externally.
        Returns:
        Whether the game is a draw

      • getIsLoss

        public boolean getIsLoss()
        Returns whether this game is a loss for the user to play currently. Note this variable is not automatically initialised, so only call this method if the variable has been initialised.
        Returns:
        Whether the game is a loss

        public void setIsWinTrue()
        Sets the game as win
